metadata.title: CVE-2016-10190 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in libavformat/http.c in FFmpeg before 2.8.10,3.0.x before 3.0.5, 3.1.x before 3.1.6, and 3.2.x before 3.2.2 allowsremote web servers to execute arbitrary code via a negative chunk size inan HTTP response.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10190` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.11-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
